paper_abstract: The internal state of the Klimov-Shamir number generator TF-1 consists of four words of size w bits each, whereas its intended strength is 2(2w). We exploit an asymmetry in its output function to show that the internal state can be recovered after having 2(w) outputs, using 2(1.5w) operations. For w = 32 the attack is practical, but for their recommended w = 64 it is only of theoretical interest.
paper_title: Theoretical cryptanalysis of the Klimov-Shamir number generator TF-1
